text:
From @ESYudkowsky, on AI

He has the courage of his convictions 

Fwiw, I don’t believe this is a serious proposal.

But risking nuclear war (a known apocalypse) to prevent AI X-risk (an entirely hypothetical one) makes no sense 

Regardless, strong AI will be built, and it won’t be “aligned”. We haven’t even figured out how to align humans! No one will be able to stop it. The growth of knowledge (of which AI is a subset) has a logic all its own. Nothing has prevented its growth in the past; we won’t be the first to break the trend. 

So we’d better hope that rogue AI is nothing to worry about. In any event, it’s not something I concern myself with.
label: certain
